attributes.action: Support "Brits Buy British" campaign and remove offshore sales advantages to reverse the recession
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If British consumers and British companies adopt a policy of buying British, or at least buying from British-owned retailers (including banks) or companies with manufacturing in the UK, the recession will have far less impact on our economy.

The Government should avoid placing contracts with non-UK companies unless with good reason and encourage UK ownership of utilities, banks and essential services.

In conjunction with this, the £18 rule should be abolished so that suppliers mainly in the Channel Islands cannot undercut UK retailers by avoiding VAT on low priced items (currently exempt up to £18).  Typically these are items sold by retail chains such as Woolworths which are important to the British economy.
